<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 287, 324, 304]]<|/det|>
## FURTHER MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 288, 905, 303]]<|/det|>
9231/23  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 312, 368, 328]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Further Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 312, 905, 328]]<|/det|>
May/June 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[840, 338, 905, 353]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 367, 393, 383]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 395, 392, 411]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 429, 222, 445]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 446, 868, 648]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 676, 213, 691]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 693, 728, 725]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 96, 94, 114]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 87, 457, 123]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(\int_{2}^{\frac{7}{2}} \frac{1}{\sqrt{4x - x^2 - 1}} \, \mathrm{d}x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 96, 920, 114]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 82, 94, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 82, 415, 101]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has parametric equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 111, 668, 133]]<|/det|>
\[x = \cosh t,\quad y = \sinh t,\quad \text{for} 0< t\leqslant \frac{3}{5}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 144, 369, 163]]<|/det|>
The length of \(C\) is denoted by \(s\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 170, 146, 191]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 165, 390, 196]]<|/det|>
Show that \(s = \int_{0}^{\frac{3}{5}} \sqrt{\cosh 2t} \, \mathrm{d}t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 175, 917, 194]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 87, 148, 104]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 84, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
By finding the Maclaurin's series for \(\sqrt{\cosh 2t}\) up to and including the term in \(t^2\), deduce an approximation to \(s\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 101, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 95, 151, 113]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 87, 504, 120]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^2 y}{\mathrm{d}x^2}\) at the point \((-2, -1)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 95, 920, 113]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 84, 94, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 98, 848, 242]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 255, 920, 293]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = x^{-2}\) for \(2 \leqslant x \leqslant N\) together with a set of \((N - 2)\) rectangles of unit width.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 304, 146, 323]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 303, 672, 323]]<|/det|>
By considering the sum of the areas of these rectangles, show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[406, 322, 922, 364]]<|/det|>
\[\sum_{r = 1}^{N}\frac{1}{r^2} >\frac{3}{2} -\frac{1}{N} +\frac{1}{N^2}. \quad [5]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 82, 97, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 82, 144, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 81, 564, 101]]<|/det|>
Find the general solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[379, 104, 620, 136]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}x}{\mathrm{d}t^{2}} +10\frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} +25x = 338\sin t. \quad [7]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 82, 146, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 82, 698, 101]]<|/det|>
Show that, for large positive values of \(t\) and for any initial conditions,

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 112, 566, 131]]<|/det|>
\[x\approx R\sin (t - \phi),\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 144, 547, 163]]<|/det|>
where the constants \(R\) and \(\phi\) are to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 144, 920, 163]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 97, 97, 115]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 96, 144, 115]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 87, 485, 131]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\sum_{r=1}^{n} z^{4r} = \frac{z^{4n+2} - z^2}{z^2 - z^{-2}}\), for \(z^2 \neq z^{-2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 96, 920, 115]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 530, 186, 549]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 529, 574, 551]]<|/det|>
By letting \(z = \cos \theta + \mathrm{i}\sin \theta\), show that, if \(\sin 2\theta \neq 0\),

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[346, 549, 645, 593]]<|/det|>
\[\sum_{r = 1}^{n}\sin (4r\theta) = \frac{\cos 2\theta - \cos (4n + 2)\theta}{2\sin 2\theta}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 81, 94, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 81, 143, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 81, 240, 100]]<|/det|>
Show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[346, 104, 653, 139]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}x}\Big(\frac{\chi}{2}\sqrt{x^{2} - 9} -\frac{9}{2}\cosh^{-1}\frac{x}{3}\Big) = \sqrt{x^{2} - 9}. \quad [3]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 112, 918, 131]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 485, 186, 504]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 485, 500, 504]]<|/det|>
Find the solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[410, 515, 588, 545]]<|/det|>
\[x\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} -y = x^{2}\sqrt{x^{2} - 9},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 552, 698, 572]]<|/det|>
given that \(y = 1\) when \(x = 3\). Give your answer in the form \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 553, 917, 572]]<|/det|>
<mark>[9]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 84, 94, 103]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 83, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
The planes \(\varPi_{1}\) and \(\varPi_{2}\) do not intersect and are both perpendicular to \(\mathbf{i} + 2\mathbf{j} + 3\mathbf{k}\) . The line \(l\) intersects \(\varPi_{1}\) at the point \((1,6,0)\) and intersects \(\varPi_{2}\) at the point \((3, - 6,0)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 131, 144, 149]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 129, 479, 151]]<|/det|>
Find Cartesian equations of \(\varPi_{1}\) and \(\varPi_{2}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 131, 920, 149]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 485, 186, 504]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 475, 920, 522]]<|/det|>
Express the vector equation of \(l\) in the form \(\left( \begin{array}{c}x \\ y \\ z \end{array} \right) = \mathbf{a} + \lambda \mathbf{b}\), where \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{b}\) are vectors to be determined, and hence show that for points on \(l\), \(\frac{1}{2} x + \frac{1}{12} y = 1\) and \(z = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 533, 920, 552]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 81, 316, 101]]<|/det|>
The matrix \(\mathbf{A}\) is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 95, 566, 153]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A} = \left( \begin{array}{llll}1 & 2 & 3\\ 1 & 2 & 3\\ \frac{1}{2} & \frac{1}{12} & 0 \end{array} \right).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 161, 146, 180]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 160, 917, 196]]<|/det|>
Show that the characteristic equation of \(\mathbf{A}\) is \(-\lambda^3 + 3\lambda^2 + \frac{7}{4}\lambda = 0\) and hence find the eigenvalues of \(\mathbf{A}\). [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 87, 148, 106]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 85, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
Find a matrix \(\mathbf{P}\) and a diagonal matrix \(\mathbf{D}\) such that \(\mathbf{A}^n = \mathbf{P}\mathbf{D}\mathbf{P}^{-1}\), where \(n\) is a positive integer. [6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[484, 55, 512, 74]]<|/det|>
<label>18</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 103, 915, 121]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 114, 920, 149]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 82, 561, 98]]<|/det|>
